snippet: As quick justice, regulators are giving cash payments to 3.8 million borrowers, but the deal is actually a way to paper over a deeply flawed review of foreclosed loans across America.
abstract: Federal banking regulators are trumpeting $8.5 billion settlement with 10 banks as quick justice for aggrieved homeowners, but deal is actually a way to paper over deeply flawed review of foreclosed loans across country; cash payments are being spread over all 3.8 million borrowers, whether there was evidence of harm or not.
lead_paragraph: As quick justice, regulators are giving cash payments to 3.8 million borrowers, but the deal is actually a way to paper over a deeply flawed review of foreclosed loans across America.

headline.main: Bank Deal Ends Flawed Reviews of Foreclosures
headline.print_headline: Bank Deal Ends Flawed Reviews Of Foreclosures

keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
